* Golden Spikes Award (2008) }} 'Gerald Dempsey "Buster" Posey III' Baggarly
  2011, p. 10. (born March 27, 1987) is an American Major League Baseball
  catcher and first baseman who plays for the San Francisco Giants. He stands
  and weighs . He bats and throws right-handed.

Posey grew up in Leesburg, Georgia. He played four sports in high school; when
playing baseball, he excelled at hitting and pitching. He attended Florida State
University, where he began playing the catcher position. He won the Golden
Spikes Award in 2008 and was selected by the Giants with the fifth overall pick
in the 2008 Major League Baseball Draft. Posey made his major league debut on
September 11, 2009. After beginning the 2010 season in the minor leagues, he was
called back up to the major leagues in May. He played first base when he came
up, but became the Giants' regular catcher at the end of June. As a senior he
played against Jason Heyward and eventually lost the Georgia State Championship
to his counterpart.

As a rookie, he finished with a .305 batting average, 18 home runs, and 67 runs
batted in. He was named the National League (NL) Rookie of the Year. He caught
every inning of the playoffs as the Giants won the 2010 World Series. In 2011,
Posey missed most of the year after he was severely injured in a collision with
Scott Cousins at home plate.

Posey returned from his injury in 2012 and had a .336 batting average to win the
2012 NL batting title. He became the second San Francisco Giant to win the
batting title. He was named the NL Most Valuable Player for 2012. He won his
second World Series that year as the Giants swept the Detroit Tigers in four
games. On March 29, 2013, Posey signed a 9-year contract extension worth $167
million, a record in sum and in length for a player with his level of experience. http://espn.go.com/mlb/story/_/id/9112620/san-francisco-giants-
lock-buster-posey-nine-year-167m-deal
categories: National League Most Valuable Player Award winners
